summary: This is an FBI FD-302 interview report of Janusz Banasiak, a former household employee of Jeffrey Epstein, conducted on October 19, 2021. Banasiak details his hiring process, job duties, the household manual, message logs, and his awareness of the investigation and Epstein's legal troubles. He also describes the execution of a search warrant at Epstein's Florida property.

persons.role: Former household employee for Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Interviewed by the FBI about his employment with Jeffrey Epstein from 2005 to 2017. Describes his duties, the household manual, and the execution of a search warrant.

persons.context: Banasiak's employer. Interviewed Banasiak for the job. Banasiak describes his travel habits, lack of friendliness with staff, and later learns of his arrest and guilty plea.

connections.description: Banasiak was employed by Epstein from 2005 to 2017 as a household manager and driver.
Maxwell interviewed Banasiak for the job and was a primary source of instructions and management for his duties.
Maxwell was involved in hiring staff for Epstein and managing household operations on his behalf.
Both were staff working for Epstein at the Florida property.

events.title: Banasiak begins employment with Epstein
events.description: Janusz Banasiak is hired through an agency, interviewed by Maxwell and Epstein, and moves to Florida to work as a household manager.

events.title: Banasiak's tenure as employee
events.description: Banasiak works for Epstein, managing the Florida property, driving Epstein and his assistants, and handling household finances and messages.

events.title: Execution of search warrant
events.description: Police arrive at Epstein's Florida property with a search warrant. Banasiak is present, and the property is searched. This is when Banasiak first learns of an investigation into Epstein.

events.title: Epstein's court appearance and guilty plea
events.description: Banasiak drives Epstein to court in Palm Beach. He later learns from the news that Epstein pleaded guilty to solicitation of underage prostitution.

events.title: Banasiak ends employment
events.description: Banasiak stops working for Epstein, having lived and worked on the property since 2005.

events.title: FBI interview of Banasiak
events.description: Janusz Banasiak is interviewed by the FBI at 380 Trinity Place, West Palm Beach, FL, regarding his employment with Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: 380 Trinity Place, West Palm Beach, FL (interview location)
Epstein's property, Florida (Banasiak's workplace and residence)
Maxwell's townhouse between Lexington Avenue and Park Avenue, New York
Epstein's office on Madison Avenue, New York
New York, New Mexico, Paris, Florida (Epstein's travel locations)
keyFacts: Janusz Banasiak worked for Jeffrey Epstein as a household manager and driver from 2005 to 2017, living in a small house on Epstein's Florida property.
Banasiak was trained using a detailed household manual that covered procedures for answering phones, maintaining the house, and Epstein's preferences.
Banasiak maintained detailed message logs for phone calls to the residence, with specific instructions not to reveal if Epstein was present.
Banasiak was present when law enforcement executed a search warrant at the Florida property, which was his first knowledge of an investigation into Epstein.
After Epstein's arrest and guilty plea, Epstein cut all employees' pay by 10% and never restored it after his release.
